awd_titl_txt: Black Sea Modeling Project:  Plankton Dynamics and          Nutrient Cycles
awd_abstract_narration: Ducklow    OCE-9616305    The general circulation, biogeochemical cycling and plankton  dynamics of the  lower trophic level of the Black Sea will be investigated  using a hierarchy of  increasing complex interdisciplinary numerical models. First  a one-dimensional  coupled physical-biological model will be used to improve  our understanding of  the biogenic element cycling, pelagic ecosystem carbon and  energy flow and  microbial processes within the deep interior and shelf  regions of the Black Sea.  Then three-dimensional studies will look at (a) the pathways  of nutrient transport  and plankton productivity on the regional scale; (b) the  patchiness of chlorophyll  concentrations in relation to mesoscale features of the  general circulation; and  (c) the exchange of nutrients and biogenic materials between  the shelf and  interior. The model results will be compared with in-situ  observations collected  by several international programs.

inst.inst_name: College of William & Mary Virginia Institute of Marine Science
